intro: Gurania brachyodonta, commonly known as the short-fruited gurania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a rough texture. Gurania brachyodonta is typically found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
